title: When David Meets Goliath: Using Smartwatches and Large Displays Together for Data Analysis
abstract: New conceptual framework developed at University of Maryland and Technische Universit√§t Dresden helps utilize multiple devices together for visual data analysis.
name: DG

title: Understanding Data by Having Computers and Humans Work Together
abstract: Introducing a new tool called DataSite for proactive visual exploration using insight-based recommendations to help analysts easily get started with data analysis.
name: datasite

title: Bridging Physical and Digital Worlds: When Your Body Is Your Tool, Data Becomes Accessible
abstract: New interaction models developed at University of Maryland and University of Manitoba utilize body and hand movement to perform data analysis on large wall-sized displays.
name: proxemiclens

title: Back to the Future: Exploring Multiple Futures in the Stock Market
abstract: A new tool called TimeFork uses interactive graphics and state-of-the-art statistical models to allow traders to investigate multiple parallel universes for predicting the stock market.
name: timefork

title: Two Infovis 2018 acceptances.
abstract: Watch out for our work on ubiquitous analytics using Vistrates and document reading with visual aids.

abstract: Recognition for oustanding research and teaching contributions at the University level.

abstract: Presented a workshop paper on affordances of input modalities for visual exploration
